'''Donald W. Marquardt''' (March 13, 1929 – July 5, 1997<ref name="QualityDigest"/>) was an American statistician, the rediscoverer of the [[Levenberg–Marquardt algorithm|Levenberg–Marquardt nonlinear least squares fitting algorithm]].<ref name="NLSA">Paul Davis (1993). [http://202.38.126.65/mirror/www.siam.org/siamnews/mtc/mtc1093.htm Levenberg–Marquart Methods and Nonlinear Estimation], ''SIAM News'', Vol. 26, Number 6, October 1993.</ref>

Marquardt joined [[DuPont]] in 1953 and worked there for 39 years. He also founded and managed the DuPont Quality Management & Technology Center.<ref name="QualityDigest">[http://www.qualitydigest.com/aug97/html/newsdig.html ''Quality Digest Magazine'', August 1997]</ref> In 1963 he published his famous paper "algorithm for least-squares estimation of nonlinear problems" in [[Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics|SIAM]] journal. Marquardt developed his algorithm to solve fitting nonlinear chemical models to laboratory data.<ref name="NLSA"/>

As manager of the DuPont Applied Statistics Group, he led development of the [[Quality Management|Product Quality Management(PQM) methodology and computer systems]] that implemented the company's continuous improvement initiatives from the mid-1970s to the late 1990s.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Marquardt |first1=Donald W.|last2=[[Dana Ulery|Ulery]]|first2=Dana L.|title=Product Quality Management |year=1991| publisher= E.I. du Pont de Nemours, Quality Management & Technology Center |location=Wilmington,DE | oclc=29224881 |url=http://www.worldcat.org/title/product-quality-management/oclc/029224881}}</ref>

In 1991, he established his own company, Donald W. Marquardt and Associates, which provides consulting and training in quality management, quality assurance, ISO 9000 standards, applied statistics, strategic planning and organizational change.<ref name="QualityDigest"/>

He died from a heart attack at the age of 68.<ref name="QualityDigest"/>

== Awards and achievements ==
* [[President of the American Statistical Association]] (1986)
* Elected member of the [[International Statistical Institute]].
* Leader of the U.S. delegation to the [[ISO 9000]] International Quality Standard writing group.
* [[American Society for Quality]] (ASQ) [[Shewhart Medal]] (1987)
* [[American Statistical Association]] Statistician of the Year (1993–94)
* [[American Statistical Association]] Founders Award (1995)
* [[American National Standards Institute]] Meritorious Service Award
